eligibility_criteria: The insured person must be a resident of Singapore.

Any claim or loss arising out of any activity or business carried out via the internet, intranet, extranet or the insured person’s own website, internet site, web address or when sending email or documents by electronic means.
meet all conditions of cover
At the time you send us your application for this insurance, none of the intended insured persons have already left Singapore on any trip meant to be covered by this insurance.
You must be a Singapore citizen or a permanent resident of Singapore.
The insured person must be at least 18 years old.
Any insured child under the age of 12 years must be accompanied by a parent or adult guardian during the trip.
To be eligible for cover under TravelEasy® Pre-Ex plans, the insured person must meet all the conditions stated under section 52 - Pre-Ex Critical Care.
The insured person must have a valid passport.
You must be at least 18 years old to purchase this policy.
The round trip must begin and end in Singapore.
You must be at least 18 years old.
Insured person must be a resident of Singapore
You must not be a government employee or a government contractor.

Insured person must comply with all requirements and advice put in place by the Singapore and relevant overseas government, transport and accommodation provider relating to measures for minimising the risk and spread of COVID-19
Minimum age of 18 years old
Singaporean resident
Resident of Singapore
The country of residence for all insured persons is Singapore.
Insured person must travel together on the same trip for single return trip travel

adult insured person

If an insured person has ever been refused cover or had special terms placed on them by any insurer for travel insurance, they must declare this at the point of application and we must accept them, or there will be no cover for them.

Any claims and losses based on, arising out of, directly or indirectly resulting from or as a result of, or any way involving: a) asbestos; or b) any actual or alleged asbestos-related injury or damage involving using asbestos, or the presence, existence, detection, removal, elimination or avoidance of asbestos or exposure or potential exposure to asbestos.
Elite Plan
For TravelEasy®, the insured persons must be in good health or free from physical defects.
Any liability which you have under an agreement but which you would not have if the agreement did not exist.

In the last 12 months, the insured person must not have any pre-existing medical condition which has required them to: a) receive treatment at a hospital's Accident and Emergency Department more than once; b) stay in a hospital as an inpatient for more than three days in a row; and c) stay in a hospital as an inpatient for more than once.
c) the insured person’s employment, trade, business or profession;
You must be at least 16 years old to purchase this policy.

Judgments which are not in the first instance delivered by or received from a court within the Republic of Singapore nor to orders received in the court for enforcing judgments made outside the Republic of Singapore whether by way of reciprocal agreement or otherwise.
Singapore resident
At the time of arranging the trip or taking out this insurance, neither you nor any other insured person is aware of any circumstances which are likely to lead to a claim under the policy.
The insured person must be following their treating doctor's advice for all their pre-existing medical condition.

replacement_of_employee.description: Replacement of employee due to COVID-19

overseas_quarantine_daily_benefit.description: daily benefit for each complete 24-hour period of quarantine or isolation

mobility_aid_reimbursement.description: Necessary expenses for buying mobility aids if a doctor says this is necessary as a result of an injury suffered by the insured person while abroad during a journey

traditional_chinese_medicine_expenses.description: Cost of traditional Chinese medical treatment by a TCM practitioner which is needed for injury and illness suffered by the insured person during the journey overseas

maternity_medical_expenses_overseas.description: Not covered for the first trimester of pregnancy, ectopic pregnancy, child birth or still birth, care and treatment for the newborn, abortion or miscarriage unless it is due to an injury, test or treatment relating to fertility, contraception, sterilisation, birth defects or congenital disorders, perinatal mental illness such as depression, anxiety disorders, any treatment for pregnancy which is conceived through medical assistance, or any medical expenses incurred in the country which the insured person is a citizen of or have been permanent residence with the local government

overseas_hospitalisation_daily_benefit.description: Benefit for each complete 24-hour period of the insured person’s stay in hospital outside Singapore due to an injury or illness suffered during the overseas journey

emergency_telephone_charges.description: Refund the insured person the actual telephone charges for using a personal mobile phone to contact our appointed assistance company, during a medical emergency and for which a medical claim has been made under section 6 - Overseas medical expenses, section 7 – Emergency dental expenses, section 10 – Traditional Chinese medicine expenses or section 11 – Maternity medical expenses overseas.

insolvency_of_licensed_travel_operator.description: Loss of travel fares or travel deposits paid by the insured person which cannot be recovered from any other source, for the journey being cancelled before the start of the journey due to bankruptcy or insolvency of a Singapore Tourism Board (STB) registered travel agency licensed and operating in Singapore from which the insured person bought the trip.

travel_postponement.description: Reasonable additional travel expenses to reschedule the insured person’s journey

replacement_of_traveller.description: Reasonable additional travel expenses for the insured person to make a one-time change of traveller

delayed_departure.description: Delay benefit and alternative travel arrangement

wedding_clothing_and_accessories.description: Accidental loss of or damage to the bridal clothing and ceremonial clothing, wedding rings, jewellery and wedding accessories owned by or hired or on loan to the adult insured person for their wedding

loss_of_travel_documents.description: Cost of getting replacement passports, travel tickets and other relevant travel documents as a result of accidental loss or damage during the journey while overseas

personal_money.description: Loss of an insured person’s cash, banknotes or traveller’s cheques carried for social and domestic purposes arising out of robbery, burglary or theft while the insured person is outside Singapore during the journey

fraudulent_use_of_credit_card.description: Unauthorised transactions due to the fraudulent use of personal credit card through unauthorised charges made overseas following its loss arising out of robbery, burglary or theft while the adult insured person is outside Singapore during the journey

credit_card_outstanding_balance.description: Outstanding balance on their personal credit card account up to the date of the accident if the adult insured person suffers an injury during the journey outside Singapore which within 90 days of its happening is the only cause of their death

personal_liability.description: All amounts which the insured person becomes legally responsible for paying compensation for accidents which happen during the journey outside Singapore and which result in: 1. death or injury of any other person; or 2. loss of or damage to property belonging to other people

legal_expenses_for_wrongful_arrest_or_de.description: Legal costs and expenses which the insured person legally has to pay due to wrongful arrest or detention by any government or local authority which happens during the journey outside Singapore

golfing_equipment.description: Loss or damage to golfing equipment due to accident or theft during the journey overseas.

green_fees.description: Overseas pre-booked green fees that are not refundable due to injury or illness.

hole_in_one.description: Cost of one round of celebratory drinks when the insured person scores a hole-in-one in an organised event.

entertainment_ticket.description: Unused portion of entertainment ticket due to death, serious injury, or serious illness of the insured person or their family member or travel companion.

rental_vehicle_excess.description: Excess if the adult insured person legally has to pay this amount due to accidental loss or damage to the rental vehicle.

returning_rental_vehicle.description: Reasonable costs for returning the rental vehicle to the nearest hire depot due to injury or illness.

requirements: Insured person must arrange for medical treatment in Singapore within 72 hours of their return to Singapore, before we will pay for further medical expenses
Insured person must receive medical treatment outside Singapore for an injury or illness suffered during the overseas journey

The insured person taking part in the following activities unless covered under section 41 – Adventurous Activities Cover: a) flying or other aerial activities except travelling as a fare-paying passenger in a properly licensed, regular scheduled commercial airline operating between licensed commercial airports; b) rafting or canoeing involving white-water rapids, jet skiing, high diving or jumping, free diving, underwater activities involving artificial breathing apparatus; c) bungee jumping, sky-diving, paragliding; d) winter sports, or any activities involving the use of a bobsleigh or skeleton; e) hunting, potholing, mountaineering that normally involves using ropes, rock climbing unless harnessed and done on man-made walls, hiking or trekking; f) speed or time trials, competitions, marathon, triathlon, ultra-marathon, sprints or racing of any kind, or as a professional sportsperson (where you could earn income, pay or sponsorship from taking part in that sport or activity) or any organised team football; g) extreme sports which involve speed, height, danger, a high level of physical exertion, highly specialised gear or special stunts; h) manual work of any kind unless you tell us when applying for the insurance and we accept this in writing; or i) expeditions or crewing a vessel from one country to another or taking part in active service in the armed forces of any nation.
Gum diseases, tooth decay, dentures, implants, crowns, bridges or use of precious metal
Nuclear radiation

Suicide or attempted suicide, intentional self-inflicted injury or any act which could reasonably be considered as exposure to danger (unless carried out in an attempt to save human life), insanity, or while the insured person is under the influence of alcohol, drugs or other substance abuse (other than drugs taken under medical supervision and not to treat drug addiction).

Changes to travel advisory or restrictions, travel arrangement, COVID-19 prevention measures issued by any government or authority relating to epidemic or pandemic at your planned destination or Singapore.
Injury or illness for more than five days and no adult member of the insured person’s family is with them.
Childbirth, miscarriage, abortion, menopause or any pregnancy related conditions with exception to cover under section 11 – Maternity medical expenses overseas.
Any deliberate, malicious, criminal or unlawful acts committed by you or the insured person or any person acting on your or their behalf.
Eyeglasses or the like, hearing aids, prosthesis, corrective devices;

The insured person taking part in naval, military, air force, civil defence or police services or operations, testing of any kind of vehicle or transport, while taking part in off-shore or in mining, aerial imaging or handling explosives, ammunitions or firearms, or travelling as an operator or crew member of any public transport.
War and civil unrest
Any expenses in respect of normal dental inspection or treatment or in obtaining dentures, retainer;

We will not pay for medical expenses caused by COVID-19 or pandemics, except for benefits extended under COVID-19 Cover under a single return trip policy or under an annual policy if COVID-19 Cover is selected and stated on the schedule or endorsement.
Pre-existing medical condition and its complications, regardless of whether it is resulting from or complicated by COVID-19 infection.
Pre-existing medical condition that worsens within the 30 days before the start of the trip
Any mental illness, anxiety state or depression suffered by the insured person and diagnosed before arranging the journey.
Terminal illness
Outpatient medical treatment
Vaccination, including the side effects and complications resulting from vaccination.

Medical expenses incurred in Singapore, or after 60 days from the date the insured person first tested positive for COVID-19 by a doctor or government approved personnel during the trip outside Singapore.
Treatment or service provided by a health spa, convalescent or nursing home or any rehabilitation centre;
Any known event.
Political risks exclusion

football; g) extreme sports which involve speed, height, danger, a high level of physical exertion, highly specialised gear or special stunts; h) manual work of any kind unless you tell us when
